result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott S. Jones in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Scott S. Jones in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard today are 14CF299 and 14CF342.
 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
  
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  
14CF299 Count 1: 60 days jail, concurrent to any sentence currently serving, Pay court costs.  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Counts 2 & 3 to be DRI.
14CF342 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF299 Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF299 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 14CF299 Counts 2 & 3, and 14CF342 is Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc concurs with joint agreement and states there is no jail credit. 

BY THE COURT:
60 days jail, concurrent to any sentence currently serving, Zeror day credit. Huber for work or counseling or any other reason jail will allow.
Pay court costs.  
Submit DNA sample, if has not done so.
Pay DNA surcharge.
Originals filed in 14CF299

to PSSI Golden County Foods re: Wage Assignment
Bail/Bond
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Amended from $500 cash to $500 signature bond.
Sign wage assignment at rate of $25 per payperiod until $500 is on deposit.

Defendant Scott S. Jones in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Scott S. Jones in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF299, 14CF342

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Renc makes arguments regarding bond. 
State agrees to 14CF299 reinstate the signature bond and in 13CF342 get a wage assignment. 

Recommends 14CF299 of $1,000 signature bond with same conditions as originally imposed. 
14CF#42 would be modified to a $500 signature bond with the condition that he sign a wage assignment until $500 is on file.

Cash bond is amended from $1,000 cash covering both files (14CF299 and 14CF342) to $500 cash on each of those files. 
Conditions previously stated remain the same: 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
Comply with all conditions of bond in 14CF128, 14CF129 and 13CM467.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Anne Renc in court.  Defendant Scott S. Jones appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF299, 14CF342

Court questions Atty Renc. 
Atty Knaapen makes bond arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes bond arguments to the Court. 
Court reviews the file.  

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
